Elite players to follow ğŸ‘€
In LaLiga: Lunin for Real Madrid and Yaremchuk for Valencia. Tsygankov and Dovbyk for Girona.
In the Premier: Zabarnyi for Bournemouth, Zinchenko for Arsenal, Mykolenko for Everton and Mudryk for Chelsea.
In the Bundesliga: Taloverov for LASK.
In Serie A: Maliovskyi for Genoa
Elite players to follow ğŸ‘€
In Serie A: Szczesny and Milik for Juventus; Skorupski and Urbanski for Bologna; Dawidowicz and Swiderski for Hellas Verona; Walukiewicz and Bereszynski for Empoli; Zielinski for Napoli; and Zalewski for Roma.
In Ligue 1: Bulka for Nice and Frankowski for Lens.
In the Premier: Kiwior for Arsenal and Moder for Brighton.
In LaLiga: Lewandowski for Barcelona.

Ukraine with its sights on the Euro Cup
Poland thinks about its complicated group
Warsaw National Stadium is ready
Among the notable events it has hosted are Euro 2012, where the opening match, two group stage matches, a quarter-final match and a semi-final were held. It has also hosted the PolishBowl (American football) and the 2014 Men's Volleyball World Championship.
In addition to the Europa League final between the Ukrainian club Dnipro and Sevilla, in which the "sevillistas" won the title, and the UEFA Super Cup 2024. The latter will face the winner of the UEFA Europa League, the Atalanta, and the winner of the UEFA Champions League final, Real Madrid, on Wednesday, August 14.
